data.title: IceHogs NHL Graduates
data.meta_description: The official website of the Rockford IceHogs. See the latest news, scores, stats and get tickets to every IceHogs home game.
data.text:
Since the IceHogs' inception in 1999, 156 different players have gone on to play at least one game in the National Hockey League while 29 players have both hoisted the Stanley Cup and played for Rockford. 24 of those players won the Stanley Cup after appearing for the IceHogs.

IceHogs NHL Alumni Quick Facts:

Of the 156 players who went on the play in the NHL after skating with the IceHogs, 120 have dressed for the IceHogs' NHL affiliate, the Chicago Blackhawks.

22 of the 24 players who earned their names on the Stanley Cup after appearing in Rockford were a member of Blackhawks' championship runs in 2010, 2013 or 2015.

Jassen Cullimore (Tampa Bay, 2004), Brett Lebda (Detroit, 2008) and Daniel Paille (Boston, 2011), Collin Fraser (Los Angeles, 2012), Brett Connolly (Washington, 2018), Jan Rutta (Tampa Bay, 2020, 2021), and Gustav Forsling (Florida, 2024) are the only IceHogs alums to win the Cup while not in the Blackhawks organization.

Niklas Hjalmarsson and Colin Fraser are the only IceHogs alumni to win three Stanley Cup Championships.

A record nine IceHogs alumni graduated to the NHL during the 2018-19 season.

Former IceHogs have suited up for all 32 current NHL teams (John Hayden was the first alumnus to skate for the Seattle Kraken when he made his Seattle debut on Jan. 21, 2023 vs. Colorado)

Raitis Ivanans become the first IceHogs alumnus to play in the NHL when he made his NHL debut with the Montreal Canadiens on October 8, 2005. Ivanans, Kevin Klein and Brandon Segal are the only IceHogs players to reach the NHL after playing for the Hogs during the team's UHL era.

In addition to the players, seven IceHogs coaches have been promoted to the NHL in team history.

Mike Haviland (Chicago Blackhawks)

Bill Peters (Detroit Red Wings, Carolina Hurricanes, Calgary Flames)

Wade Flaherty (Winnipeg Jets)

Andrew Allen (Buffalo Sabres)

Matt Prefontaine (Winnipeg Jets)

Jeremy Colliton (Chicago Blackhawks)

Sheldon Brookbank (Chicago Blackhawks)

Derek King (Chicago Blackhawks)
